full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 168 of 197 2709 LCHVMAX6

AFTERNOON SESSION
3:15 P.M.
THE COURT: Okay. We have a few things to take up.
Ms. Comey.
MS. COMEY: Yes, your Honor. We appreciate the Court's indulgence. We've reached a number of stipulations, and I believe we'll be able to finish the case this afternoon as a result. So we very much appreciate the Court's patience with the parties.
There is one issue that I believe the defense still wanted to raise that we were not able to reach agreement on. I would propose that we have that argument now and then, depending on the result of that, I think we can proceed to wrap the case up.
THE COURT: Okay. All right.
How long will the reading of stips take?
MS. COMEY: Ten to 15 minutes, your Honor.
THE COURT: Oh, okay. So I didn't know if we were talking an hour, in which case my suggestion was going to be let's do that and then give the jury a break and then finish, but okay. I'll hear the issue.
Ms. Menninger.
MS. MENNINGER: Thank you, your Honor.
As your Honor is aware from prior proceedings in this trial, one of the facts about which there is dispute involves
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00016897
